title: Coconut prices exceed Rs. 200 in local markets
byline: The price of coconuts across various areas of the country has reportedly increased, with the cost of a single coconut in the local market exceeding Rs. 200.

title: Fair weather prevails in most areas in country
byline: While there will be a few showers in the Galle and Matara districts and in the Northern Province, fair weather will prevail in most parts of the country, the Meteorology Department said.

title: Bureaucratic delay puts over 200 specialists at risk of retirement
byline: A delay in issuing a crucial circular/ Gazette has put over 200 specialist doctors in Sri Lanka at risk of premature retirement, threatening the country’s public health service, Daily Mirror learns

title: MPs, Ministers refuse luxury vehicles due to low fuel efficiency: Speaker
byline: Claiming that there is a large fleet of unused luxury vehicles, Speaker Dr. Shoka Ranwala said yesterday most MPs and Ministers refuse to use luxury vehicles due to their low fuel efficiency.

title: Biden issues official pardon for son Hunter
byline: US President Joe Biden has issued an official pardon for his son Hunter, who was facing sentencing for two criminal cases.

title: New Zealand reports first case of H7 bird flu
byline: Highly pathogenic avian influenza has been detected at a poultry farm in New Zealand’s South Island, authorities said on Monday, the first time the island nation has reported a highly pathogenic variant of avian influenza.

title: Colombo consumer prices fall deeper into deflation on cuts to fuel prices
byline: Inflation in the Colombo district fell further into deflationary territory in November, as expected by the Central Bank last week, as non-food prices fell sharply while food prices decelerated from a month ago.

title: US collaboration to develop roadmap for sustainable SL port development
byline: The United States is actively working with the Sri Lankan government to develop a roadmap for the sustainable development of the country’s port sector, as part of its multi-faceted support for the maritime industry, according to a senior US diplomat.

title: Cricket legend Sangakkara speaks about rise of unregulated franchise leagues
byline: Former Sri Lanka cricket captain Kumar Sangakkara has voiced concerns about increasing corruption in cricket, driven by the rise of unregulated franchise leagues.

title: Vehicle importer opens registrations ahead of import ban lift
byline: Since the government has approved the resumption of vehicle imports, a leading vehicle importer has started registering individuals interested in purchasing new vehicles once the restriction on private vehicle imports is lifted.

title: World Test Championship - State of Play ahead of 2025 final
byline: South Africa and England’s comprehensive wins over Sri Lanka and New Zealand respectively have strong bearings on the ICC World Test Championship 2025 equations.

title: Two injured, 4 arrested during Education Ministry protest
byline: Two Development Officers attached to the teachers’ service were injured and four others were arrested during a protest in front of the Education Ministry, police said.

title: Protest by Development Officers causes traffic congestion on Kottawa-Borella road
byline: A severe traffic congestion was reported on the Kottawa-Borella road in front of the Education Ministry due to a protest by Development Officers attached to the teaching service.

title: SJB Parliamentary group to meet today to decide on Chief Opposition Whip: MP
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Parliamentary group is to meet at 5 pm today where it will select the Chief Opposition Whip and those who will participate in the debate on President Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s policy statement, which will be held in Parliament tomorrow.

title: Lohan, his wife further remanded
byline: Former State Minister Lohan Ratwatte and his wife Shashi Prabha Ratwatte were further remanded till December 6 over the case involving an unregistered luxury vehicle.

title: Air Quality Index improving: CEA
byline: The Air Quality Index which was between 100 to 180 during the last few days has reduced to 100 and 110 by yesterday, the Central Environment Authority (CEA) said.

title: New Chief Justice sworn in
byline: Supreme Court Justice Murdu Nirupa Bidushinie Fernando was officially sworn in as the Chief Justice of Sri Lanka before President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today (02) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Dozens killed in crush at Guinea football match
byline: Dozens of people have died in a crush following clashes at a football match in Guinea’s second-largest city, N’zérékoré, local media report.

title: Sharujan’s ton helps Sri Lanka U-19 coast to second win
byline: Sharujan Shanmuganathan continued his batting prowess as he cracked a match-winning knock of 102 runs to help Sri Lanka U-19 coast to a convincing 131-run win over Afghanistan U-19 in the ongoing Under-19 Asia Cup tournament encounter played at Sharjah.
